<!-- Generated by build task Generate_Repo_Docs. Do not edit manually. -->
# Get-MCDConfig

Source: `source/Private/Core/Get-MCDConfig.ps1`

## Synopsis

Loads the MCD configuration from a JSON file.

## Description

This function reads the MCD configuration from a JSON file and returns an MCDConfig
object. If the configuration file does not exist, it can optionally create a new
configuration with default values.

## Parameters

| Name | Type | Mandatory | Pipeline | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Path | String | No | No | The path to the configuration file. Defaults to the standard MCD configuration location at $env:ProgramData\MCD\config.json.   |
| CreateIfMissing | SwitchParameter | No | No | If specified and the configuration file does not exist, creates a new configuration with default values and saves it to the specified path.   |

## Examples

### Example 1

```powershell
$config = Get-MCDConfig

Loads the configuration from the default location.
```

### Example 2

```powershell
$config = Get-MCDConfig -Path 'D:\MCD\config.json'

Loads the configuration from a custom path.
```

### Example 3

```powershell
$config = Get-MCDConfig -CreateIfMissing

Creates a new configuration file with defaults if it doesn't exist.
```
